1. Legal nature of the case.
The case of the so-called “Bakkar scandal” was a classic example of theft of shares, which was committed by the management of Kolymaenergo, with the assistance of some of its employees and the bankers. The management of the company, in violation of the law, fraudulently sold the shares of the company to the investors, using the bank accounts of the company and the bank payment orders, which were forged by the employees of the company. The amount of the shares sold was ten times more than the amount of the shares, which were actually bought by the investors.
The legal nature of the case is defined by the fact that the management of the company committed a fraudulent act, which was aimed at stealing the shares of the company from its lawful owners. The management of the company, in violation of the law, used the bank accounts of the company and the bank payment orders, which were forged by the employees of the company, in order to sell the shares of the company to the investors, and then to use the money, which was obtained from the sale of the shares, for their own benefit.
The legal remedies that are available to the injured parties in this case are as follows:
1.1. The injured parties have the right to claim compensation for the damage, which they suffered as a result of the fraudulent act of the management of the company.
1.2. The injured parties have the right to seek the recovery of the shares, which were sold to them fraudulently.
1.3. The injured parties have the right to seek the cancellation of the sale of the shares, which were sold to them fraudulently.
1.4. The injured parties have the right to seek the recovery of the money, which was obtained from the sale of the shares, and which was used for the benefit of the management of the company.
1.5. The injured parties have the right to seek the punishment of the persons, who committed the fraudulent act, and who are responsible for the damage, which they suffered.
